instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Mid 2011 iMac 21.5" Temperature (TS2p) sensor above limit error
threads.message: Working on a MId 2011 iMac 21.5" and ASD  reports  Temperature (TS2p) sensor above limit error.  Any pointers on where to start ?

threads.title: Mid 2011 iMac 21.5" Temperature (TS2p) sensor above limit error
threads.message: Should mention that the system boots normally, but after about 5 minutes the fans go on high and then about 10 minutes later the screen will go solid grey (no image).  If left alone the display returns and the process repeats.  The system never shuts off or reboots.

threads.title: Mid 2011 iMac 21.5" Temperature (TS2p) sensor above limit error
threads.message:
"[I]Temperature (TS2P) -- S2 Camera Proximity [/I]"
Could mean the same as in MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
So check the cam, or its cable.

threads.title: Mid 2011 iMac 21.5" Temperature (TS2p) sensor above limit error
threads.message: Turns out this was due to some sort of "crust" on the board in the area of the camera connection to the Logicboard.  I've seen this a couple of other times on iMacs where it looks like liquid damage but extremely light AND in an area that there's no way liquid could have gotten only there.  Very strange but a light surface cleaning resolved the issue and it now passed ASD with flying colors.
